pylapp.smoothclicker.android.tools.screen

Class UnlockerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.tools.screen.UnlockerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UnlockerStub

    public class UnlockerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements UnlockerStub
    A class which can unlock a device (i.e. unlock the lock screen). It will uses a configuration file to make to unlock it. This configuration file must contain the commands to execute in ADB Shell. It must be defined in the app's dedicated folder and have the name sc_unlock.sh/b>. To push it in the device: 
                adb push sc_unlock.sh /storage/emulated/legacy/Smooth_Clicker/
    Here a sample of such file (For a Samsung Galaxy S3 with Android 4.4.4 through CyanogenMod 11) 
                #  With an unlock pattern where the unlock item is on the right bottom)
                 input swipe 350 1050 700 1050
            # With a pattern to swipe with four points
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 57 14
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 1 330 1

                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 53 192
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 54 1032
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 58 57
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 0 0 0

                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 53 347
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 54 882
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 58 57
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 0 0 0
                 sleep 1

                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 53 375
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 54 1033
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 58 57
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 0 0 0
                 sleep 1

                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 53 542
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 54 1027
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 58 57
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 0 0 0
                 sleep 1

                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 3 57 4294967295
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 1 330 0
                 sendevent /dev/input/event2 0 0 0

                 echo "UNLOCK_DONE" # Do not forget it!
    Since:
    31/05/2016
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    pylapp

    • Method Detail

      • unlock

        public void unlock(UnlockerStub.UnlockCallback callback)
            throws UnlockerStub.UnlockException
        Unlocks the device and trigger the callback when the unlock process has been done. It will wait for a token displayed by the script, the token "UNLOCK_DONE". When the current thread reads in the process output this token, it will exit from its loop and let the task do its remaining job.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface UnlockerStub
        Parameters:
        callback - - The callback to trigger, can be null
        Throws:
        UnlockException - - Thrown when something wrong occurs during the unlock process
        UnlockerStub.UnlockException
